1.description: Maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

2.description: Ensure all accounts with password logins comply with NIST’s standards for developing and managing password policies.

3.description: Require multifactor authentication for all services to the extent possible, particularly for webmail, VPN, and accounts that access critical systems.

4.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date. Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities in internet-facing systems.

5.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware by controlling traffic flows between subnetworks and restricting adversary lateral movement.

6.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of the indicated ransomware with a network monitoring tool.

7.description: Prevent unknown or untrusted origins from accessing remote services on internal systems.

8.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

9.description: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts.

10.description: Audit user accounts with administrative privileges and configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege.

11.description: Disable unused ports to reduce the attack surface.

12.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization.

13.description: Disable hyperlinks in received emails to prevent phishing attacks.

14.description: Implement time-based access for accounts set at the admin level and higher using the just-in-time (JIT) access method.

15.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions to prevent privileged escalation and lateral movement.

16.description: Maintain offline backups of data and regularly maintain backup and restoration.

17.description: Ensure backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organization’s data infrastructure.
